New Records: India scored 171/7 in 20 overs after winning the toss.
England was all out for 103 in 16.4 overs.
Axar Patel was the Player of the Match with three wickets.
Rohit Sharma scored 57 off 39 balls and Suryakumar Yadav scored 47 off 36 balls.
Kuldeep Yadav and Axar Patel each took three wickets.
Key Match Events: Rain delays affected the match start time and toss decision.
England decided to bowl first after winning the toss.
The match had several turning points, including key wickets and partnerships.
Rain interruptions and ground conditions were significant factors.
Pre-Game Insights: England's skipper Jos Buttler won the toss and decided to bowl first.
Both teams kept the same XI for the crucial match.
Rohit Sharma emphasized the importance of adapting to conditions and staying focused.
Post-Match Reflections: India's skipper Rohit Sharma praised the team's effort and adaptability.
England's skipper Jos Buttler acknowledged India's superior performance and the challenges faced.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was the second semi-final of the T20 World Cup 2024.
India and England have a significant head-to-head record in T20 World Cups.
Both teams had specific strategies, with England relying on spinners and India on batting strength.
Others: The weather conditions and the impact of rain on the match are detailed.
